main event: Airmen observed a bright, white round object moving in circular motion near Lake Charles Air Force Base on 6 September 1952.
interesting points: The object was described as brighter than a star and moved in circular patterns,The object ascended and descended at irregular intervals,The same or similar object was sighted again the following night and appeared to move faster,The sighting lasted roughly two hours,The conclusion of the report suggested that the object was likely a balloon.
witness description: Airmen stationed at Lake Charles AFB
